question: Who adopts Codex standards for three spices?
option3: Food Safety and Standards Authority of India
option4: Federal Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Consumer Protection
explanation: The Codex Alimentarius Commission (CAC) adopted three Codex standards for black, white and green pepper, cumin and thyme. The adoption of Codex standards paves the way for universal agreement on identifying quality spices in various countries. It also set reference points and benchmarks for member-nations to align their national standards for spices with Codex.
